newsitem.title: FRANCE: TENNIS-MAJOLI WINS FRENCH OPEN WOMEN'S TITLE.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-MAJOLI WINS FRENCH OPEN WOMEN'S TITLE.

text.p: Croatia's Iva Majoli won the French Open tennis tournament women's title by beating world number one Martina Hingis of Switzerland in straight sets in Saturday's final.
Majoli, the ninth need, handed top seed Hingis her first defeat this year by winning 6-4 6-2 to take her first grand slam title.
Majoli, 19, who was appearing in the final of a grand slam tournament for the first time, won a $654,115 cheque.
The 16-year-old Hingis, who had won all of her 37 previous matches this year, earned $327,058.
Hingis, who became the youngest winner of a grand slam title when she took the Australian Open last January, was widely favoured to win for the first time on the Paris clay.
But Majoli, looking more relaxed, dictated the game thanks to powerful forehands and made fewer mistakes than her opponent on her way to a major upset.
